Pre-Game Insights: Los Angeles Lakers are looking to continue their three-game road winning streak against the Houston Rockets.
The Rockets have gone 14-8 against Western Conference opponents and are the worst team in the Western Conference shooting 32.5% from 3-point range.
The Lakers are 16-7 against Western Conference opponents and are sixth in the Western Conference with 15.9 fast break points per game led by LeBron James averaging 4.6.
The Rockets are shooting 44.1% from the field this season, 3.5 percentage points lower than the 47.6% the Lakers allow to opponents.
The Lakers average 11.8 made 3-pointers per game this season, 0.5 fewer makes per game than the Rockets allow.
Alperen Sengun is averaging 18.9 points, 10.6 rebounds and five assists for the Rockets.
Austin Reaves is shooting 44.5% and averaging 18.2 points for the Lakers.

In their last 10 games, the Rockets have a 6-4 record, averaging 108.4 points, 46.5 rebounds, 20.2 assists, 8.2 steals, and 4.9 blocks per game while shooting 44.6% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 106.1 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Lakers have a 6-3 record, averaging 112.3 points, 45.2 rebounds, 26.0 assists, 7.2 steals, and 5.1 blocks per game while shooting 46.9% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 108.8 points.
Injuries for the Rockets include Jae'Sean Tate (day to day, illness), Tari Eason (day to day, rest), and Jabari Smith Jr. (out, hand).
Injuries for the Lakers include Jarred Vanderbilt (out, knee), Gabe Vincent (day to day, oblique), Christian Wood (out, knee), and Jalen Hood-Schifino (day to day, hamstring).
